dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: We, the Raen, left the surface long ago that we might forge ourselves a peaceful life under the sea. Maintaining such serenity, however, is not always easy─my two sons can attest to that.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: From the crack of dawn until dusk they fight. Lately, things have started to escalate and they have begun to trouble the entire village with their spats.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: I have scolded them on multiple occasions, telling them that such disturbing behavior is unacceptable. They, however, still refuse to listen. Perhaps you can try having a word with them?

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: You can start with my eldest son. He should be over by the racks of dried fish. If he attempts to start a fight with you when you approach him, I suggest you respond with a resounding huh. That should stop him.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: Should he try to start a fight with you, I suggest you look him in the eye and respond with a resounding huh.

dialogue.name: NAUGHTYBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: Huh? What do you want? Stop wasting my time. Hurry up and say what it is you've come to say!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By his cocky attitude you sense Mahiwa's eldest son is trying to pick a fight with you. You best huh at him before things get any further out of hand.

dialogue.name: NAUGHTYBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: I will tell you one last time. If there is something you have come to say to me, say it! If not, begone from my sight!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By his cocky attitude you sense Mahiwa's eldest son is trying to pick a fight with you. You best huh at him before things get any further out of hand.

dialogue.name: NAUGHTYBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: Huh? Huh!? Wh-Who do you think you are to take such a lofty tone with me!? Well, if it is a fight you want, it is a fight you will get!

dialogue.name: NAUGHTYBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: But wait... Perhaps this is what Mother meant when she said I had an unpleasant attitude. Now that I think on it, I have often done to my brother what you just did to me. Maybe it's what caused our constant brawls.

dialogue.name: NAUGHTYBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: I understand now. Thank you, madamsir...and my apologies for trying to fight you. If you happen to see my brother, please tell him I am sorry.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: You came to tell me my brother says he is sorry? I do not believe you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Mahiwa's younger son appears to be in a sour mood and seems to be looking to take it out on someone. You best huh at him before things get any further out of hand.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: Please, leave me. I just want to be alone!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Mahiwa's younger son appears to be in a sour mood and seems to be looking to take it out on someone. You best huh at him before things get any further out of hand.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: So my eldest son has finally come around? That is wonderful to hear! I only hope you see the same amount of success when you speak with my younger son.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: What do you─ You did that because I seem grumpy!? No, you misunderstand.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: <sigh> Mother also often comments that I seem sullen. I am not─I simply do not have much to say. Perhaps my brother has also been mistaking my silence for anger and that is why he shouts at me.

dialogue.name: MYSTERIOUSBROTHER02698
dialogue.text: I must go and sort this out with him. Thank you, madamsir. You have made me realize how important it is to let others know what I am thinking. I shall go find my brother now!

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: Perhaps now they will be able to find a way to reconcile their differences. Thank you. Until you came along I was at a loss as to what to do.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: By nature, we avoid using any harsh words or actions. As such, most of what I have to say is easily brushed aside by my children.

dialogue.name: MAHIWA
dialogue.text: You, however, have gotten through to them where I could not. Now the people of the village need not be disturbed by their angry shouts any longer. Please accept this small gift as a token of my appreciation.
